name: City of Stockholm, Environment and Health Committee
goal: The City of Stockholm's Environment and Health Administration, MF, is the authority responsible for the environmental health of the City. MF has approximately 200 employees. The long-term target is for Stockholm to be continue to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases at the same rate as between 1990 and 2005, thus achieving the goal “Fossil Fuel Free City 2040”. The environmental work in the City is guided by the Environment Program and Stockholm’s Action Program on Climate Change (SACC).
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Internal Market, Public Health, Research and Technology, Taxation, Transport
euInitiatives: Hazardous substances, biodiversity, climate adaptation, climate mitigation and energy efficiency, water, health, air quality, noise reduction.
